info.author: Alice
info.description:
There are usefull classes and functions.

CLASSES::

01 : File
	This class operate file object.
	If you want to call this class, Please write file name at argument.
	After call, this class make status attribute.
	The keys in status attribute, "access","path","size" and "extention".	
	
	Methods:
		01 : readonly() -- return file object with read mode.
		02 : writeonly(string) -- write string to file.
		03 : makefile() -- make file, and return a new status attribute.
		04 : overwrite(string)	-- overwrite string to file.
		05 : othermode(mode=None) -- return file object with other mode.
		06 : writeobj(object) -- write object to file.
		07 : loadobj() -- return object that loaded.
		08 : overwriteobj(object) -- overwrite object to file.

02 : DictSearch
	This class supporte a search method for dictionary.
	If you want to call this class, Please write dictionary at argument.
	
	Methods:
		01 : findkey(string) -- search key in dictionary and return True or False.
		02 : findKeyString(string) -- search key name in dictionary.
		03 : findValue(string) -- search value in dictionary.


FUNCTIONS::

01 : urlanalyze(url)
	Analyze url string and return result at dictionary.
	This function return data.
	It is "protocol", "domain", "dirs", "filename","ext" and "parameter".

02 : headeranalyze(header)
	Analyze hease string return result at dictionary.
	
03 : dropsame(list)
	Delete same item of list.
	
04 : todict(variable,comment=None)
	Convert dictionary from variable.
	variable is string or list only.
	The second argument is first letter of the list elements.

	exsample:
		>>> list = ["#sample","path=/usr/local/bin"]
		>>> todict(list,"#")
		({"path":"/usr/local/bin"},["#sample"])
	
05 : greplist(list,string):
	Find element string from list.
	
	example:
		>>> list = ["abc","def","ghi"]
		>>> greplist(list,"a")
		"abc"

06 : dropN(var):
	Delete a "¥n" string from variable.
	variable is string or list only.
	
07 : checktype(var,argtype=None)
	Check type of variable.
	if you don't input argtype, this function print type of var.

	argtypes:
		01 : String
		02 : List
		03 : Dict
		04 : Int
		05 : Float
		06 : Unicode
		07 : Tuple
		08 : Func
		09 : Class
		10 : Method
		11 : Nonetype

08 : choice(num,mode=None):
	make random string.
	Please input number of the string that you want to make random string.
	And, the second argument is mode of this funtion.

	mode:
		01 : Non_symbol   -- Big and small rome string, number only. 
		02 : Non_number   -- Big and small rome string, symbol only.
		03 : Only_rome    -- Big and small rome string only.
		04 : Only_symbol  -- Symbol only.
		05 : Only_number  -- Number only.
		06 : ALL          -- Big and small rome string, symbol, number.

09 : exp(dict)
	Get keys and values from dictionary.
	
	example:
		>>> dict = {"key":"sample1","key2":"sample2"}
		>>> exp(dict)
		(["key","key2"],["sample1","sample2"])
info.name: usable
info.summary: there are a usefull functions and classes.
